event.summary: 2/4/1993: Unknown perpetrators set a fire at the South County Medical Center in Venice, Florida, United States. There were no casualties, but the abortion clinic sustained $70,000 in damages.
event.motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in Florida.
event.propcomment: Two waiting rooms damaged. Also, multiple rooms in building sustained smoke damage.
event.addnotes: The fire was ignited around 12:40 AM and was extinguished one hour later. Previously, the abortion clinic had been the target of many protests.
event.scite1: "Suspicious Fire Damages Clinic That Does Abortions," Orlando Sentinel, February 5, 1993.
event.scite2: "Canadians Warned About Traveling in Florida," St. Petersburg Times, February 5, 1993.
event.scite3: "Chronological History of Arsons and Bombings Against Abortion Providers," National Abortion Federation.
